definition:
on or for the day after today                                      
             
             will do it tomorrow

the day after the present                                      
             
             the court will recess until tomorrow

future sense 1a                                      
             
             the world of tomorrow
on, during, or for the day after today
the day after today
the future

on the day after today                                      
             
             Meet me tomorrow.
in: will do it tomorrow
the court will recess until tomorrow
the world of tomorrow
I'll finish the housework tomorrow.
Is it supposed to rain tomorrow?
He has an interview tomorrow.
Tomorrow is a school day.
She is giving a presentation at tomorrow's meeting.
Who knows what tomorrow may bring?
designing the car of tomorrow
Today's children are tomorrow's leaders.
All we can do is hope for a better tomorrow.
Meet me tomorrow.

definition: on the day after today
in the future
in: Are you going back home tomorrow?
tomorrow morning/afternoon/night: They’re arriving tomorrow morning.
a week tomorrow/tomorrow week ​British  (=in a week’s time starting from tomorrow): I’ll see you a week tomorrow, then.
Who can say what will happen tomorrow?

definition: (on) the day after today:
used more generally to mean the future:
on the day after today:
the day after today:
If you say you will see someone tomorrow morning/night/at noon/etc., you mean you will see that person on the next day at that time:
Tomorrow can also mean the future:
in: I'm having dinner with Rachel tomorrow night.
Oh, leave it till tomorrow.
Is John coming to tomorrow's meeting?
He'll be back tomorrow week/a week tomorrow (= a week from tomorrow).
He'll be back a week from tomorrow.
Today's problem child may be tomorrow's criminal.
We make sacrifices now to give our children a better tomorrow.
He said he’ll call tomorrow after work.
Tomorrow’s meeting has been postponed.
I’ve arranged to see Rachel tomorrow morning/at ten.
Today’s problem child may be tomorrow’s brilliant scientist.
What matters from this perspective is not the children of today, but the adults of tomorrow.
Markers are particles such as ' therefore ' or ' so ', or indexicals such as ' today ' or ' tomorrow ', that modify the proposition.
And if your action tomorrow is necessary it is not free.
If the horizon is extended, changes in tomorrow's parameter estimates will matter for more future periods.
But the margins, as the conference amply demonstrated, offer opportunities enough - and today's margins have a habit of becoming tomorrow's mainstream.
The f and y components of x match those for x because both components are in the decision-maker's information set tomorrow.
The reality is retirement saving represents a payoff that is too distant and uncertain, and pleasure promised tomorrow means pain today.
As a result, a friend wrote to me of 'a blight tomorrow' when she was clearly intending to be optimistic.
In contrast, when states value future payoffs almost as much as current ones, accepting an agreement today or tomorrow does not make a big difference.
Of course this is not needed for today's performance but may be vital for tomorrow's revival.
Yesterday's enemy is today's friend and good neighbour and tomorrow's partner in cooperation, and vice versa.
For today's student, an ingrained understanding of the sentience of nonhuman animals will lead to a better scientist tomorrow.
But this means that it is tomorrow's satisfaction that matters, not today's assessment of tomorrow's satisfaction.
I don't think she would have told me yes if she didn't intend on showing up tomorrow.
Child delinquents have a 2- to 3-fold increased risk of becoming tomorrow's serious, violent, and chronic offenders.

definition: A mystical land in which 99% of human productivity, motivation, and achievement is stored.

Marginalized Orientations, Gender identities, And Intersex. it’s meant to be an all inclusive umbrella term for asexuals, homosexuals, multisexuals, trans people, and intersex people. Alternative to LGBTQIAP+
Alternative to MOGII, easier to pronounce.

A mythical period in time which everyone knows about but has no memory of.
A lot of people say that it is the day after today and that tomorrow will be here at midnight, but if you actually wait until midnight it is today again.
Often used by people to put off work as the new required deadline will never arrive.
(noun) The day when all essays currently being written are due.
an undetermined time period spanning from never to eternity, often used when talking to a girl
The best time to do anything you had planned for today.
One of the greatest labor saving devices of today.
